ABENABAP_TECHNO

The term [ABAP](ABENABAP_GLOSRY.html) as an abbreviation for *Advanced Business Application Programming* encompasses the entire ABAP technology provided for and by an [ABAP system](ABENABAP_SYSTEM_GLOSRY.html) on which ABAP-based applications are developed and executed. Originally, ABAP stood for the [ABAP language](ABENABALA_GLOSRY.html) only. ABAP technology is not provided as a standalone produ

/abap-docs-standard/ABENABAP_TECHNO

ABENABAP_OBJ_PROGR_MODEL_GUIDL

ABAP is a hybrid programming language that supports both a procedural and an object-oriented programming model. The procedural programming model is based on the modularization of programs in procedural processing blocks (event blocks, dialog modules, function modules, and subroutines). In ABAP Objects, the class conceptually supersedes the procedural program, and modularization is implemented usin

/abap-docs-standard/ABENABAP_OBJ_PROGR_MODEL_GUIDL

ABENABAP_GLOSRY

Advanced Business Application Programming. ABAP in the actual sense is the name of the [ABAP language](ABENABALA_GLOSRY.html), but in a broader sense it is also the term for the entire [ABAP technology](ABENABAP_TECHNO_GLOSRY.html) provided for and by an [ABAP system](ABENABAP_SYSTEM_GLOSRY.html). ABENTECHNO\_GLOSSARY.html ABENABALA\_GLOSSARY.html

/abap-docs-standard/ABENABAP_GLOSRY

In the following, terms of the [ABAP Glossary](ABENABAP_GLOSSARY.html) are listed, that are relevant for the [ABAP Language](ABENABAP_REFERENCE.html). Advanced Business Application Programming. ABAP in the actual sense is the name of the [ABAP language](ABENABALA_GLOSRY.html), but in a broader sense it is also the term for the entire [ABAP technology](ABENABAP_TECHNO_GLOSRY.html) provided for and

/abap-docs-standard/ABENABALA_GLOSSARY

ABENMODULARIZATION_GUIDL

The main programming model that was propagated before the implementation of ABAP Objects was *structured programming*: The implementation of object-oriented programming languages such as ABAP Objects does not make structured programming obsolete. Object-oriented programming is based on the structured programming and enhances and supplements it. With regard to ABAP, you must note that ABAP is still

/abap-docs-standard/ABENMODULARIZATION_GUIDL

ABENSAVER_MAP_MESSAGES

`base_class` stands for the base class from which the RAP saver class inherits, for example, `CL_ABAP_BEHAVIOR_SAVER`. The following points are relevant for this RAP saver method: Development guide for the ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model, section [Message Mapping](https://help.sap.com/docs/ABAP_Cloud/f055b8bf582d4f34b91da667bc1fcce6/741dfc88293d4ac99186815b9fc35e31?version=sap_cross_pro

/abap-docs-standard/ABENSAVER_MAP_MESSAGES

ABENRAP_GLOSSARY

RAP stands for the [ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model](ABENARAP_GLOSRY.html). In the following, terms of the [ABAP Glossary](ABENABAP_GLOSSARY.html) are listed, that are relevant for RAP. **ABAP behavior pool** ABP for short. A special [class pool](ABENCLASS_POOL_GLOSRY.html) for an [ABAP behavior implementation](ABENBEHAVIOR_IMPLEMENT_GLOSRY.html). A behavior pool is based on a [RAP beha

/abap-docs-standard/ABENRAP_GLOSSARY

ABAPINVALID_STMTS_IN_TX

The following restrictions apply to operations and/or statements in the modify and save [transactional phases](ABENTR_PHASE_GLOSRY.html). *X* means it is allowed. -   In a RAP transaction, the modify transactional phase includes the [RAP interaction phase](ABENRAP_INT_PHASE_GLOSRY.html) and [RAP early save phase](ABENEARLY_RAP_SAVE_PHASE_GLOSRY.html). The save transactional phase includes the [RAP

/abap-docs-standard/ABAPINVALID_STMTS_IN_TX

ABENSAVER_FINALIZE

`base_class` stands for the base class from which the RAP saver class inherits, for example, `CL_ABAP_BEHAVIOR_SAVER`. The following points are relevant for this RAP saver method: Development guide for the ABAP RESTful Application Programming Model, section [Save Sequence Runtime](https://help.sap.com/docs/ABAP_Cloud/f055b8bf582d4f34b91da667bc1fcce6/ab7459048c7e4ecda98d0b6f51b01e7b?version=sap_cro

/abap-docs-standard/ABENSAVER_FINALIZE

ABENDDIC_VIEWS

A [DDIC view](ABENDDIC_VIEW_GLOSRY.html) is a grouping of columns of one or more DDIC database tables, resulting in an application-specific view. In AS ABAP, views are defined in ABAP Dictionary and can be referenced as data types in the same way as DDIC structures. Views can be used like DDIC database tables in reading ABAP SQL statements and, with some limitations, also in writing ABAP SQL state

/abap-docs-standard/ABENDDIC_VIEWS

ABENXSA_GLOSRY

Short for SAP HANA extended application services Advanced Model. Current version of [XS](ABENXS_GLOSRY.html) and successor to [XSC](ABENXSC_GLOSRY.html). [SAP Web IDE for SAP HANA](ABENSAP_WEB_IDE_FOR_SAP_HAN_GLOSRY.html) and [SAP HANA Cockpit](ABENSAP_HANA_COCKPIT_GLOSRY.html) can be used to develop and manage XSA objects. Objects are usually deployed using [HDI](ABENHDI_GLOSRY.html). ABENTECHNO\

/abap-docs-standard/ABENXSA_GLOSRY

ABENDDIC_DATA_ELEMENTS

A [DDIC data element](ABENDATA_ELEMENT_GLOSRY.html) defines an [elementary data type](ABENELEMENTARY_DATA_TYPE_GLOSRY.html) or a [reference type](ABENREFERENCE_TYPE_GLOSRY.html). DDIC data elements describe the technical type properties and the semantic meaning of an object that is defined with reference to the data element. Data elements are the elementary components of complex types such as [DDI

/abap-docs-standard/ABENDDIC_DATA_ELEMENTS

Expressions: Functional Methods of the object Note A functional method is a method of a business object or ABAP class that returns one return value only (parameter Result or Returning ). ... Method with Multiple Exporting Parameters If you use a method with multiple Exporting or Changing parameters, you have to specify which of the export parameters to use as the return value. ... However, you can also use a different method with at least one export parameter.In this case you have to specify which export parameter to use as the return value. ... — Product: SAP ERP (6.0 EHP5 Latest) https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ERP/142f8559883b4c11966ebfb99dd61164/4f32f7086d7418cbe10000000a42189e.html?locale=en-US&state=PRODUCTION&version=6.05.latest

Excel Support Warnings returned by the ABAP List Viewer export tool are written into the application log. ... Errors returned by the ABAB List Viewer export tool are returned as HTTP 500 errors. ... Properties with the SAP-semantic "URL" are created as "Link to URL" columns in the ABAP List Viewer export tool. ... — Product: SAP S/4HANA (1709 FPS02 (May 2018)) https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_ON-PREMISE/68bf513362174d54b58cddec28794093/a24c8490449041b88b7890d299b57351.html?locale=en-US&state=PRODUCTION&version=1709 002

Programming Synchronous Methods In the case of synchronous methods, a result and/or the export parameters can be returned to the caller if you pass this to the container CONTAINER within the method implementation. ... A synchronous method can be implemented with a function module. The function module is called in the program with the ABAP command CALL FUNCTION. ... Note If you have fully maintained the ABAP function type of the method and the method parameters, the system implements the call to the relevant function and the data declaration of the method parameters ... — Product: SAP ERP (6.0 EHP4 Latest) https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ERP/142f8559883b4c11966ebfb99dd61164/4f3c1021944e2b93e10000000a42189e.html?locale=en-US&state=PRODUCTION&version=6.04.latest

Binding to Object References (Instances) They are not affected by the EXPORTING, CHANGING or RETURNING parameters of the ABAP method. ... You do not have to specify optional parameters, or the usual ABAP additions EXPORTING, IMPORTING, CHANGING, or RETURNING. ... However, the argument list is superfluous, since the RETURNING parameter of the ABAP method. ... — Product: SAP NetWeaver 7.0 (SPS39) https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_NETWEAVER_700/1099d5b96c531014ae27d839c339133b/c3021959f06111d4b2eb0050dadfb92b.html?locale=en-US&state=PRODUCTION&version=7.0.39
